text: December unemployment rates ranged from 3.0% in NE and SD to 9.3% in HI.
Only ID, UT, and WA saw an increase in Q3 GDP over the year.
Every state except ID saw a yearly decline in leisure and hospitality jobs in December.
From Q3 2019 to Q3 2020, house price increases ranged from 4.0% in ND to 14.4% in ID.
Average private weekly earnings in December ranged from $778 in MS to $1,862 in DC.
Unemployment rates remain above their Great Recession peaks in CO, HI, and NM.
Hawaii’s Q3 2020 GDP from accommodation and food services nearly halved from Q3 2019.
In 24 states and DC, December 2020 retail employment was lower than in December 2019.
Between Q2 and Q3 2020, real GDP from manufacturing increased in all 50 states and DC.
Yearly state and local public jobs declined more than 10% in ME, NV, and NH.
Tennessee and 19 other states hit a decade high in annual house price growth in Q3 2020.
